H0.text: The world was first aware of the Chernobyl disaster after detectors were triggered at a nuclear plant in which country. Norway

H1.text: The world was first aware of the Chernobyl disaster after detectors were triggered at a nuclear plant in which country. Finland

H2.text: The world was first aware of the Chernobyl disaster after detectors were triggered at a nuclear plant in which country. Poland

H3.text: The world was first aware of the Chernobyl disaster after detectors were triggered at a nuclear plant in which country. SWEDEN

A4.text: On the morning of 28 April, radiation levels set off alarms at the Forsmark Nuclear Power Plant in Sweden, over 1,000 kilometres (620 mi) from the Chernobyl Plant.

A5.text: The Swedish government contacted the Soviet government to inquire about whether there had been a nuclear accident in the Soviet Union.
